moves.1. e4: I am white and its a basic kings pawn opening, as a casual player i never experimented with any other.
moves.4... Qe7 5. dxe5 dxe5 6. Bb5+: This is a mistake on my part,i'm expecting a bishop or knight to exchange and castle without wasting tempo
moves.7... Nf6 8. Bd3 Qc7 9. O-O Be7 10. Nc3 b: im expected him to take my c-pawn so that i can develop my knight.
moves.18... Nc5 19. Bc2 Bb5 20. cxb4: I grabbed his b pawn knowing that there is a pin.
moves.20... Ne6 21. bxa5 O-O 22. Nc3 Ba6 23. N: I thought of exchanging my knight to get rid of f6 knight which is putting a lot of pressure on my e4 pawn.
moves.23... Nxd5 24. exd5 Nc5 25. b4 Nd7 26. R: trying some cheap tactics to gain the queen.(Bh7+ kxh7 Rxq)
moves.26... Qd6 27. Be3 Bd8: I dont know why he made this move but this is the moved that killed him in end.
moves.28. Nxe5: Sacrificing knight to gain a rook.
moves.33... Nxc1 34. Re8#:
Thats it.
Proper play by my opponent would definitely earn him win but its just another day and i'm glad to mate him in the end even though he has a huge material advantage.

Do post your comments if you like the game.
Thank you Gameknot for this opportunity.
